function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Development of codo ontology without expert input or validation","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Importing data from an unreliable or inaccurate source","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate security measures for the exported ontology data","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Development of new drugs and antibodies may not cover all variations of the human coronavirus, leading to gaps in treatment options.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Synchronous development of ontologies with the appearance of new diseases may lead to gaps in coverage and understanding of specific disease aspects.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Dependency on existing ontologies and integration of terms from multiple sources may introduce inconsistencies and errors in the cido ontology.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Reuse of non-biomedical ontologies in infectious diseases ontologies","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of thorough testing and validation of ontology development tools","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Diffusion of pandemics ontologies through various websites may lead to the spread of incorrect or incomplete information.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited evaluation of developed ontologies using only description logic dl queries may result in incomplete validation of the ontologies.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of a comprehensive ontology that models multiple similar diseases may hinder the effective sharing of knowledge and development of vaccines and drugs for emerging pandemics.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of adoption of biomedical application ontologies","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate development of new ontologies","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited use of tools and languages for ontology development","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Exposure to uv-c radiation from the surfacide system","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Handling of dried virus and potential exposure to infectious material","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Handling of infectious materials in the built environment","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Testing mers-cov sensitivity to uv-c under strict containment bsl3 laboratory protocols","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Moist environment created by bleach-soaked pads preventing drying of virus onto glass coverslips","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Plaque counts indicating reduction of viral titers in the laboratory environment","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Uv-c exposure time of only 5 minutes resulted in undetectable virus levels for mers-cov and sars-cov.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Whole-room uv-c system effectiveness against rna viruses like mhv-a59, mers-cov, and sars-cov.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Use of the surfacide whole-room uv-c disinfection system during mers outbreaks may prevent nosocomial spread of the virus and protect staff.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Exposure to harmful uv-c light due to improper installation or maintenance of uvgi systems","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Insufficient uv-c irradiation doses to inactivate sars-cov-2 virions in respiratory droplets","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Unproven effectiveness of upper-room uvgi in inactivating sars-cov-2 virions in the air","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"The potential for incomplete viral inactivation due to the saturation of the ’target’ with uv photons","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inaccurate prediction of virus behavior due to unknown z values for specific viral species","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Misinterpretation of uv inactivation plots for some viral species leading to ineffective disinfection strategies","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"The assumption that the room air is well mixed may not hold true in all situations, leading to inaccurate calculations of average particle residence time and irradiation flux.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inaccurate adjustment of z values for use with upper-room uvgi systems may lead to ineffective disinfection of microbes suspended in the air.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Incorrect computation of average irradiation flux may result in insufficient uvgi exposure to achieve the desired survival fraction of microbes.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Unclear disinfection methodology for built environments","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Variability in published data on uv irradiation of coronaviruses","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Exclusion of studies with high log reductions","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Bias due to pseudo-replication","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Uncertainty in effective upper-room z value for aerosolised sars-cov-2","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Estimating the average upper-room irradiation flux for reduction in aerosolised sars-cov-2 virions may lead to incorrect uv-c dosing","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Modeling the performance of a standard upper-room uv fitting when challenged by sars-cov-2 may result in inaccurate assessment of its effectiveness","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Reliance on published literature and studies for uv-c doses and log reductions without independent validation introduces risk of using potentially inaccurate data","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Studies on the susceptibility of different viruses to uv irradiation could lead to the underestimation of the risk of contagion in real-world scenarios.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited experimental studies on the uv irradiation of aerosolized viruses may result in a lack of understanding of the efficacy of uv treatment on airborne transmission of contagious diseases.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Aerosolised viruses appear to be more vulnerable to uv damage than when they are suspended in a liquid or on a substrate.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Irradiating the coronavirus in liquid requires a uv-c dose that is in the region 1.8-6.0 times higher than that required when the virus is suspended in air.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"The adjustment coefficient c_ur for uv-c dose when the virus is suspended in air may be in a range 0.167-0.545.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Assumptions made regarding z ur value for upper-room uvgi analysis based on published mean z values for aerosolised coronaviruses","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Uncertainty associated with assumed z ur value and introduction of worst-case scenario","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Direct inverse relationship between z ur, particle residence time, and required irradiation flux","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Exposure to uv light may cause harm to human skin and eyes.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inequality in susceptibility to uv damage among different coronaviruses.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"}]}
